label: 国人
本: Terms and Concepts in Japanese Medieval History . Journal of Japanese Studies . 1983
説明文: Men of the province. Local warriors or zaichi ryōshu. Their holdings were of indeterminate size. Nominally under the control of a shugo daimyō, they nonetheless enjoyed considerable independence of control over their own territory-usually a shōen. The most important local figure in the Muromachi period; some kokujin were descendants of Kamakura period jitō gokenin families.　[在地領主、守護大名、荘園、地頭、御家人]"
